name: Aboleth
Traits:
Anfibio. The aboleth può respirare aria e acqua.

Nuvola di muco. While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a TS Costituzione CD 14. In caso di fallimento, the creature is diseased for 1d4 hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

Telepatia investigativa. If a creature communicates telepaticamente with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.
Actions:
Multicolpo. The aboleth makes three tentacle attacks.

Tentacle. Attacco con arma da mischia: +9 a colpire, portata 3 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 12 (2d6 + 5) danni contundenti. If the target is a creature, it deve superare un TS Costituzione CD 14 or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease. After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by heal or another disease-curing spell of 6th level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it subisce 6 (1d12)acido every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

Tail. Attacco con arma da mischia: +9 a colpire, portata 3 m un bersaglio. Colpito: 15 (3d6 + 5) danni contundenti.

Asservire (3/Day). The aboleth targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target deve superare un TS Saggezza CD 14 or be magically charmed by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The charmed target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepaticamente with each other over any distance.

Whenever the charmed target takes damage, the target can repeat the tiro salvezza. In caso di successo, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the tiro salvezza when it is at least 1.61 km away from the aboleth.
Legendary Actions:
The aboleth can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The aboleth regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Individuare. The aboleth makes a Wisdom (Percezione) check.

Colpo di Coda. The aboleth makes one tail attack.

Drenaggio Psichico (Costs 2 Azioni). One creature charmed by the aboleth subisce 10 (3d6)danni psichici, and the aboleth regains hit points equal to the damage the creature takes.

name: Acolyte
Traits:
Spellcasting. The acolyte is a 1st-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 12, +4 a colpire with spell attacks). The acolyte has following cleric spells prepared:

Cantrips (at will): light, sacred flame, thaumaturgy

1st level (3 slots): bless, cure wounds, sanctuary
Actions: Club. Attacco con arma da mischia: +2 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 2 (1d4) danni contundenti.

name: Adult Black Dragon
Senses: Blindsight 18.3 m, Darkvision 36.6 m, Percezione Passiva 21
Traits:
Anfibio. The dragon può respirare aria e acqua.

Resistenza Leggendaria (3/Day). If the dragon fails a tiro salvezza, it can choose to succeed instead.
Actions:
Multicolpo. The dragon can use its Presenza Terrificante. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

Bite. Attacco con arma da mischia: +11 a colpire, portata 3 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 17 (2d10 + 6) danni perforanti plus 4 (1d8) danni da acido.

Claw. Attacco con arma da mischia: +11 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 13 (2d6 + 6) danni taglienti.

Tail. Attacco con arma da mischia: +11 a colpire, portata 4.6 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 15 (2d8 + 6) danni contundenti.

Presenza Terrificante. Ogni creatura of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it deve superare un TS Saggezza CD 16 or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the tiro salvezza at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's tiro salvezza is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Presenza Terrificante for the next 24 hours.

Acid Breath (Ricarica 5–6). The dragon exhales acid in a 60-­foot line that is 5 feet wide. Ogni creatura in quella linea must make a TS Destrezza CD 18, taking 54 (12d8) danni da acido on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Legendary Actions:
The dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dragon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Individuare. The dragon makes a Wisdom (Percezione) check.

Tail Attack. The dragon makes a tail attack.

Wing Attack (Costs 2 Azioni). The dragon beats its wings. Ogni creatura within 10 feet of the dragon deve superare un TS Destrezza CD 19 or take 13 (2d6 + 6) danni contundenti and be knocked prone. The dragon can then volare up to half its flying speed.

Repulsion Breath. The dragon exhales repulsion energy in a 30-foot cone. Ogni creatura in quell'area deve superare un TS Forza CD 19. On a failed save, the creature is pushed 60 feet away from the dragon.

Change Shape. The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Colpito Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Resistenza Leggendaria, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

name: Air Elemental
Damage Resistances: Lightning, Thunder; Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
Condition Immunities: Exhaustion, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained, Unconscious
Traits: Air Form. The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.
Actions:
Multicolpo. The elemental makes two slam attacks.

Slam. Attacco con arma da mischia: +8 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 14 (2d8 + 5) danni contundenti.

Whirlwind (Ricarica 4–6). Ogni creatura in the elemental's space must make a TS Forza CD 13. In caso di fallimento, a target subisce 15 (3d8 + 2)danni contundenti and is flung up 20 feet away from the elemental in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target subisce 3 (1d6)danni contundenti for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature deve superare un TS Destrezza CD 13 or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

Se il tiro salvezza ha successo, the target takes half the danni contundenti and isn't flung away or knocked prone.

name: Androsphinx

Traits:
Inscrutable. The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. Wisdom (Intuizione) checks made to ascertain the sphinx's intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

Magic Weapons. The sphinx's weapon attacks are magical.

Spellcasting. The sphinx is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 18, +10 a colpire with spell attacks). It requires no material components to cast its spells. The sphinx has the following cleric spells prepared:

Cantrips (at will): sacred flame, spare the dying, thaumaturgy

1st level (4 slots): command, detect evil and good, detect magic

2nd level (3 slots): lesser restoration, zone of truth

3rd level (3 slots): dispel magic, tongues

4th level (3 slots): banishment, freedom of movement

5th level (2 slots): flame strike, greater restoration

6th level (1 slot): heroes' feast
Actions:
Multicolpo. The sphinx makes two claw attacks.

Claw. Attacco con arma da mischia: +12 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 17 (2d10 + 6) danni taglienti.

Roar (3/Day). The sphinx emits a magical roar. Each time it roars before finishing a long rest, the roar is louder and the effect is different, as detailed below. Ogni creatura within 500 feet of the sphinx and able to hear the roar must make a tiro salvezza.

First Roar. Ogni creatura that fails a TS Saggezza CD 18 is frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat the tiro salvezza at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Second Roar. Ogni creatura that fails a TS Saggezza CD 18 is deafened and frightened for 1 minute. A frightened creature is paralyzed and can repeat the tiro salvezza at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Third Roar. Ogni creatura makes a TS Costituzione CD 18. On a failed save, a creature subisce 44 (8d10)thunder damage and is knocked prone. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't knocked prone.
Legendary Actions:
The sphinx can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The sphinx regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Claw Attack. The sphinx makes one claw attack.

Teleport (Costs 2 Azioni). The sphinx magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Azioni). The sphinx casts a spell from its list of prepared spells, using a spell slot as normal.

Magic Resistance. The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
Actions:

name: Basilisk
Traits:
Petrifying Gaze. If a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the basilisk and the two of them can see each other, the basilisk can force the creature to make a TS Costituzione CD 12 if the basilisk isn't incapacitated. On a failed save, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the tiro salvezza at the end of its next turn. In caso di successo, the effect ends. In caso di fallimento, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

A creature that isn't surprised can avert its eyes to avoid the tiro salvezza at the start of its turn. If it does so, it can't see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again.

If it looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save. If the basilisk sees its reflection within 30 feet of it in bright light, it mistakes itself for a rival and targets itself with its gaze.

Swallow. The behir makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. A behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time.

If the behir subisce 30damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir deve superare un TS Costituzione CD 14 at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the behir. If the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

Actions:

Each animated chain is an object with AC 20, 20 hit points, resistance to danni perforanti, and immunity to psychic and thunder damage. When the devil uses multiattack on its turn, it can use each animated chain to make one additional chain attack. An animated chain can grapple one creature of its own but can't make attacks while grappling. An animated chain reverts to its inanimate state if reduced to 0 hit points or if the devil is incapacitated or dies.
Reactions: Unnerving Mask. When a creature the devil can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the devil, the devil can create the illusion that it looks like one of the creature's departed loved ones or bitter enemies. name: Clay Golem

Traits:

Berserk. Whenever the golem starts its turn with 60 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

Immutable Form. The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

Magic Resistance. The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

The target dies if this attack reduces its hit point maximum to 0. The reduction lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

Haste (Ricarica 5–6). Until the end of its next turn, the golem magically gains a +2 bonus to its AC, has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and can use its slam attack as a bonus action.

name: Cloaker
Traits:
Damage Transfer. While attached to a creature, the cloaker takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down), and that creature takes the other half.

False Appearance. While the cloaker remains motionless without its underside exposed, it is indistinguishable from a dark leather cloak.

Light Sensitivity. While in bright light, the cloaker has disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom (Percezione) checks that rely on sight.
Actions:
Multicolpo. The cloaker makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

Bite. Attacco con arma da mischia: +6 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, one creature. Colpito: 10 (2d6 + 3) danni perforanti, and if the target is Large or smaller, the cloaker attaches to it. If the cloaker has advantage against the target, the cloaker attaches to the target's head, and the target is blinded and unable to breathe while the cloaker is attached. While attached, the cloaker can make this attack only against the target and has advantage on the attack roll. The cloaker can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the cloaker by succeeding on a DC 16 Strength check.

Tail. Attacco con arma da mischia: +6 a colpire, portata 3 m, one creature. Colpito: 7 (1d8 + 3) danni taglienti.

Moan. Ogni creatura within 60 feet of the cloaker that can hear its moan and that isn't an aberration deve superare un TS Saggezza CD 13 or become frightened until the end of the cloaker's next turn. If a creature's tiro salvezza is successful, the creature is immune to the cloaker's moan for the next 24 hours.

Phantasms (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). The cloaker magically creates three illusory duplicates of itself if it isn't in bright light. The duplicates move with it and mimic its actions, shifting position so as to make it impossible to track which cloaker is the real one. If the cloaker is ever in an area of bright light, the duplicates disappear.

Whenever any creature targets the cloaker with an attack or a harmful spell while a duplicate remains, that creature rolls randomly to determine whether it targets the cloaker or one of the duplicates. A creature is unaffected by this magical effect if it can't see or if it relies on senses other than sight.

A duplicate has the cloaker's AC and uses its saving throws. If an attack hits a duplicate, or if a duplicate fails a tiro salvezza against an effect that deals damage, the duplicate disappears.

1/day each: control weather, gaseous form
Actions:

On a failed save, the creature begins to turn to stone and is restrained. It must repeat the tiro salvezza at the end of its next turn. In caso di successo, the effect ends. In caso di fallimento, the creature is petrified for 24 hours.

On a failed save, the creature can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, but not both. These effects last for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the tiro salvezza at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself with a successful save.

In a new form, the couatl retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and other actions are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks. name: Darkmantle
Traits:

False Appearance. While the darkmantle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a cave formation such as a stalactite or stalagmite.
Actions:
Crush. Attacco con arma da mischia: +5 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, one creature. Colpito: 6 (1d6 + 3) danni contundenti, and the darkmantle attaches to the target. If the target is Medium or smaller and the darkmantle has advantage on the attack roll, it attaches by engulfing the target's head, and the target is also blinded and unable to breathe while the darkmantle is attached in this way.

While attached to the target, the darkmantle can attack no other creature except the target but has advantage on its attack rolls. The darkmantle's speed also becomes 0, it can't benefit from any bonus to its speed, and it moves with the target.

A creature can detach the darkmantle by making a successful DC 13 Strength check as an action. On its turn, the darkmantle can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement.

Darkness Aura (1/Day). A 15-­-foot radius of magical darkness extends out from the darkmantle, moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as the darkmantle maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell). Darkvision can't penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

Every 24 hours that elapse, the creature must repeat the tiro salvezza, reducing its hit point maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure. This reduction lasts until the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

name: Deep Gnome (Svirfneblin)

Innate Spellcasting. The gnome’s innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 11). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

1/day each: blindness/deafness, blur, disguise self
Actions:

Colpito: 4 (1d4 + 2) danni perforanti, and the target deve superare un TS Costituzione CD 12 or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the tiro salvezza at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Deer

name: Deva
Damage Resistances: Radiant; Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
Traits:
Angelic Weapons. The deva's weapon attacks are magical. When the deva hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 danni radianti (included in the attack).

Innate Spellcasting. The deva's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17). The deva can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

At will: detect evil and good

1/day each: commune, raise dead

Magic Resistance. The deva has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
Actions:
Multicolpo. The deva makes two melee attacks.

Mace. Attacco con arma da mischia: +8 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 7 (1d6 + 4) danni contundenti plus 18 (4d8) danni radianti.

Healing Touch (3/Day). The deva touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 (4d8 + 2) hit points and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

Change Shape. The deva magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating equal to or less than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the deva's choice).

In a new form, the deva retains its game statistics and ability to speak, but its AC, movement modes, Strength, Dexterity, and special senses are replaced by those of the new form, and it gains any statistics and capabilities (except class features, legendary actions, and lair actions) that the new form has but that it lacks.

name: Dire Wolf
Traits:
Keen Hearing and Smell. The wolf has advantage on Wisdom (Percezione) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

Pack Tactics. The wolf has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wolf's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.
Actions: Bite. Attacco con arma da mischia: +5 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 10 (2d6 + 3) danni perforanti. If the target is a creature, it deve superare un TS Forza CD 13 or be knocked prone.

name: Djinni
Traits:
Elemental Demise. If the djinni dies, its body disintegrates into a warm breeze, leaving behind only equipment the djinni was wearing or carrying.

Innate Spellcasting. The djinni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 17, +9 a colpire with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: detect evil and good, detect magic, thunderwave

3/day each: create food and water (can create wine instead of water) , tongues, wind walk

1/day each: conjure elemental (air elemental only), creation, gaseous form, invisibility, major image, plane shift
Actions:
Multicolpo. The djinni makes three scimitar attacks.

Scimitar. Attacco con arma da mischia: +9 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 12 (2d6 + 5) danni taglienti plus 3 (1d6) lightning or thunder damage (djinni's choice).

Create Whirlwind. A 5-foot-radius, 30-foot-tall cylinder of swirling air magically forms on a point the djinni can see within 120 feet of it. The whirlwind lasts as long as the djinni maintains concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). Any creature but the djinni that enters the whirlwind deve superare un TS Forza CD 18 or be restrained by it. The djinni can move the whirlwind up to 60 feet as an action, and creatures restrained by the whirlwind move with it. The whirlwind ends if the djinni loses sight of it.

A creature can use its action to free a creature restrained by the whirlwind, including itself, by succeeding on a DC 18 Strength check. If the check succeeds, the creature is no longer restrained and moves to the nearest space outside the whirlwind.

name: Doppelganger
Traits:
Shapechanger. The doppelganger can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

Ambusher. The doppelganger has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

Surprise Attack. If the doppelganger surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 (3d6) damage from the attack.
Actions:
Multicolpo. The doppelganger makes two melee attacks.

Slam. Attacco con arma da mischia: +6 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 7 (1d6 + 4) danni contundenti.

Read Thoughts. The doppelganger magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the doppelganger can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the doppelganger's concentration isn't broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target's mind, the doppelganger has advantage on Wisdom (Intuizione) and Charisma (Inganno, Intimidire, and Persuasione) checks against the target.

name: Draft Horse
Actions: Hooves. Attacco con arma da mischia: +6 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 9 (2d4 + 4) danni contundenti.

name: Dragon Turtle
Damage Resistances: Fire
Traits: Anfibio. The dragon turtle può respirare aria e acqua.
Actions:
Multicolpo. The dragon turtle makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws. It can make one tail attack in place of its two claw attacks.

Bite. Attacco con arma da mischia: +13 a colpire, portata 4.6 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 26 (3d12 + 7) danni perforanti.

Claw. Attacco con arma da mischia: +13 a colpire, portata 3 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 16 (2d8 + 7) danni taglienti.

Ogni creatura in quell'area must make a TS Costituzione CD 18, taking 52 (15d6) danni da fuoco on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Being underwater doesn't grant resistance against this damage.

Actions:
Multicolpo. The dretch makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

It lasts for 1 minute or until a strong wind disperses it. Any creature that starts its turn in that area deve superare un TS Costituzione CD 11 or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. While poisoned in this way, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both, and can't take reactions.

name: Drider

1/day each: darkness, faerie fire

Spider Climb. The drider can arrampicarsi difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Sunlight Sensitivity. While in sunlight, the drider has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Percezione) checks that rely on sight.

Web Walker. The drider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.
Actions:
Multicolpo. The drider makes three attacks, either with its longsword or its longbow. It can replace one of those attacks with a bite attack.

Bite. Attacco con arma da mischia: +6 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, one creature. Colpito: 2 (1d4) danni perforanti plus 9 (2d8) danni da veleno.

Longsword. Attacco con arma da mischia: +6 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 7 (1d8 + 3) danni taglienti, or 8 (1d10 + 3) danni taglienti if used with two hands.

Longbow. Attacco con arma a distanza: +6 a colpire, range 45.7/182.9 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 7 (1d8 + 3) danni perforanti plus 4 (1d8) danni da veleno.

name: Drow
Traits:
Fey Ancestry. The drow has advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t put the drow to sleep.

At will: dancing lights

1/day each: darkness, faerie fire

Sunlight Sensitivity. While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Percezione) checks that rely on sight.
Actions:

If the tiro salvezza fails by 5 or more, the target is also unconscious while poisoned in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

name: Druid

Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produce flame, shillelagh

1st level (4 slots): entangle, longstrider, speak with animals, thunderwave

2nd level (3 slots): animal messenger, barkskin
Actions: Quarterstaff. Attacco con arma da mischia: +2 a colpire (+4 a colpire with shillelagh), portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 3 (1d6) danni contundenti, 4 (1d8) danni contundenti if wielded with two hands, or 6 (1d8 + 2) danni contundenti with shillelagh.

name: Dryad
Traits:
Innate Spellcasting. The dryad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The dryad can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

At will: druidcraft

3/day each: entangle, goodberry

1/day each: barkskin, pass without trace, shillelagh

Magic Resistance. The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Speak with Beasts and Plants. The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

Tree Stride. Once on her turn, the dryad can use 10 feet of her movement to step magically into one living tree within her portata and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.
Actions:
Club. Attacco con arma da mischia: +2 a colpire (+6 a colpire with shillelagh), portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 2 (1d4) danni contundenti, or 8 (1d8 + 4) danni contundenti with shillelagh.

Fey Charm. The dryad targets one humanoid or beast that she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the dryad, it deve superare un TS Saggezza CD 14 or be magically charmed. The charmed creature regards the dryad as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the dryad's control, it takes the dryad's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can.

Each time the dryad or its allies do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the tiro salvezza, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the dryad dies, is on a different plane of existence from the target, or ends the effect as a bonus action. If a target's tiro salvezza is successful, the target is immune to the dryad's Fey Charm for the next 24 hours.

The dryad can have no more than one humanoid and up to three beasts charmed at a time.

Sunlight Sensitivity. While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Percezione) checks that rely on sight.
Actions:

While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). The duergar magically turns invisible until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is invisible with it.

name: Dust Mephit

Actions:

Blinding Breath (Ricarica 6). The mephit exhales a 15- foot cone of blinding dust. Ogni creatura in quell'area deve superare un TS Destrezza CD 10 or be blinded for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the tiro salvezza at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Eagle

Actions: Talons. Attacco con arma da mischia: +4 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 4 (1d4 + 2) danni taglienti.

Siege Monster. The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures.

Actions:

Scimitar. Attacco con arma da mischia: +10 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 13 (2d6 + 6) danni taglienti plus 7 (2d6) danni da fuoco.

Hurl Flame. Ranged Spell Attack: +7 a colpire, range 36.6 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 17 (5d6) danni da fuoco.

name: Elephant

If the elephant moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, that target deve superare un TS Forza CD 12 or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the elephant can make one stomp attack against it as a bonus action.
Actions:
Gore. Attacco con arma da mischia: +8 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 19 (3d8 + 6) danni perforanti.

Stomp. Attacco con arma da mischia: +8 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, one prone creature. Colpito: 22 (3d10 + 6) danni contundenti.

name: Elk

Actions:
Ram. Attacco con arma da mischia: +5 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 6 (1d6 + 3) danni contundenti.

Hooves. Attacco con arma da mischia: +5 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, one prone creature. Colpito: 8 (2d4 + 3) danni contundenti.

Traits:

Magic Resistance. The erinyes has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
Actions:
Multicolpo. The erinyes makes three attacks.

Longsword. Attacco con arma da mischia: +8 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 8 (1d8 + 4) danni taglienti, or 9 (1d10 + 4) danni taglienti if used with two hands, plus 13 (3d8) danni da veleno.

Longbow. Attacco con arma a distanza: +7 a colpire, range 45.7/182.9 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 7 (1d8 + 3) danni perforanti plus 13 (3d8) danni da veleno, and the target deve superare un TS Costituzione CD 14 or be poisoned. The poison lasts until it is removed by the lesser restoration spell or similar magic.
Reactions: Parry. The erinyes adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the erinyes must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

name: Ettercap
Traits:
Spider Climb. The ettercap can arrampicarsi difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Web Sense. While in contact with a web, the ettercap knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

Web Walker. The ettercap ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.
Actions:
Multicolpo. The ettercap makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

The target deve superare un TS Costituzione CD 11 or be poisoned for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the tiro salvezza at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Claws. Attacco con arma da mischia: +4 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 7 (2d4 + 2) danni taglienti.

Web (Ricarica 5–6). Attacco con arma a distanza: +4 a colpire, range 9.1/18.3 m, one Large or smaller creature. Colpito: The creature is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained creature can effettuare un TS 11 Strength check, escaping from the webbing on a success. The effect also ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 10, 5 hit points, vulnerability to danni da fuoco, and immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and danni psichici.

name: Ettin

Wakeful. When one of the ettin's heads is asleep, its other head is awake.
Actions:
Multicolpo. The ettin makes two attacks: one with its battleaxe and one with its morningstar.

Battleaxe. Attacco con arma da mischia: +7 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 14 (2d8 + 5) danni taglienti.

Morningstar. Attacco con arma da mischia: +7 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 14 (2d8 + 5) danni perforanti.

name: Fire Elemental
Damage Resistances: Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
Condition Immunities: Exhaustion, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained, Unconscious
Traits:
Fire Form. The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it subisce 5 (1d10)fuoco. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature subisce 5 (1d10)fuoco and catches fire; until someone takes an action to douse the fire, the creature subisce 5 (1d10)fuoco at the start of each of its turns.

Illumination. The elemental sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light in an additional 30 feet.

Water Susceptibility. For every 5 feet the elemental moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it subisce 1freddo.
Actions:
Multicolpo. The elemental makes two touch attacks.

Touch. Attacco con arma da mischia: +6 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 10 (2d6 + 3) danni da fuoco. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target subisce 5 (1d10)fuoco at the start of each of its turns.

name: Fire Giant
Actions:
Multicolpo. The giant makes two greatsword attacks.

Greatsword. Attacco con arma da mischia: +11 a colpire, portata 3 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 28 (6d6 + 7) danni taglienti.

Rock. Attacco con arma a distanza: +11 a colpire, range 18.3/73.2 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 29 (4d10 + 7) danni contundenti.

name: Flameskull
Damage Resistances: Lightning, Necrotic, Piercing
Traits:
Illumination. The flameskull sheds either dim light in a 15-foot radius, or bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. It can switch between the options as an action.

Magic Resistance. The flameskull has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Rejuvenation. If the flameskull is destroyed, it regains all its hit points in 1 hour unless holy water is sprinkled on its remains or a dispel magic or remove curse spell is cast on them.

Spellcasting. The flameskull is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13, +5 a colpire with spell attacks). It requires no somatic or material components to cast its spells. The flameskull has the following wizard spells prepared:

  • Cantrip (at will): mage hand
  • 1st level (3 slots): magic missile, shield
  • 2nd level (2 slots): blur, flaming sphere
  • 3rd level (1 slot): fireball
Actions:
Multicolpo. The flameskull uses Fire Ray twice.

Fire Ray. Ranged Spell Attack: +5 a colpire, range 9.1 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 10 (3d6) danni da fuoco.

name: Flesh Golem
Damage Immunities: Lightning, Poison; Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks that aren't Adamantine
Condition Immunities: Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned
Languages: Understands the languages of its creator but can't speak
Traits:
Berserk. Whenever the golem starts its turn with 40 hit points or fewer, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its hit points.

The golem's creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to effettuare un TS 15 Charisma (Persuasione) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If it takes damage while still at 40 hit points or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

Aversion of Fire. If the golem takes danni da fuoco, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

Immutable Form. The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

Lightning Absorption. Whenever the golem is subjected to danni da fulmine, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the danni da fulmine dealt.

Magic Resistance. The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Magic Weapons. The golem's weapon attacks are magical.
Actions:
Multicolpo. The golem makes two slam attacks.

Slam. Attacco con arma da mischia: +7 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 13 (2d8 + 4) danni contundenti.

name: Flying Snake
Traits: Flyby. The snake doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's portata.
Actions: Bite. Attacco con arma da mischia: +6 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 1 danni perforanti plus 7 (3d4) danni da veleno.

name: Flying Sword
Condition Immunities: Blinded, Charmed, Deafened, Frightened, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned
Traits:
Antimagic Susceptibility. The sword is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the sword deve superare un Constitution tiro salvezza against the caster's spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

False Appearance. While the sword remains motionless and isn't flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal sword.
Actions: Longsword. Attacco con arma da mischia: +3 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 5 (1d8 + 1) danni taglienti.

name: Frog
Traits:
Anfibio. The frog può respirare aria e acqua.

Standing Leap. The frog's long jump is up to 10 feet and its high jump is up to 5 feet, with or without a running start.

name: Frost Giant
Actions:
Multicolpo. The giant makes two greataxe attacks.

Greataxe. Attacco con arma da mischia: +9 a colpire, portata 3 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 25 (3d12 + 6) danni taglienti.

Rock. Attacco con arma a distanza: +9 a colpire, range 18.3/73.2 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 28 (4d10 + 6) danni contundenti.

name: Gargoyle
Damage Resistances: Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks that aren't Adamantine
Traits: False Appearance. While the gargoyle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate statue.
Actions:
Multicolpo. The gargoyle makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

Bite. Attacco con arma da mischia: +4 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 5 (1d6 + 2) danni perforanti.

Claws. Attacco con arma da mischia: +4 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 5 (1d6 + 2) danni taglienti.

name: Gelatinous Cube
Condition Immunities: Blinded, Charmed, Deafened, Exhaustion, Frightened, Prone
Traits:
Ooze Cube. The cube takes up its entire space. Other creatures can enter the space, but a creature that does so is subjected to the cube's Engulf and has disadvantage on the tiro salvezza.

Creatures inside the cube can be seen but have total cover.

A creature within 5 feet of the cube can take an action to pull a creature or object out of the cube. Doing so requires a successful DC 12 Strength check, and the creature making the attempt subisce 10 (3d6)acido.

The cube can hold only one Large creature or up to four Medium or smaller creatures inside it at a time.

Transparent. Even when the cube is in plain sight, it takes a successful DC 15 Wisdom (Percezione) check to spot a cube that has neither moved nor attacked. A creature that tries to enter the cube's space while unaware of the cube is surprised by the cube.
Actions:
Pseudopod. Attacco con arma da mischia: +4 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, one creature. Colpito: 10 (3d6) danni da acido.

Engulf. The cube moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter Large or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the cube enters a creature's space, the creature must make a TS Destrezza CD 12.

On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the cube. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed tiro salvezza.

On a failed save, the cube enters the creature's space, and the creature subisce 10 (3d6)acido and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can't breathe, is restrained, and subisce 21 (6d6)acido at the start of each of the cube's turns. When the cube moves, the engulfed creature moves with it.

An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to effettuare un TS 12 Strength check. In caso di successo, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the cube.

name: Ghast
Damage Resistances: Necrotic
Traits:
Stench. Any creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the ghast deve superare un TS Costituzione CD 10 or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful tiro salvezza, the creature is immune to the ghast's Stench for 24 hours.

Turning Defiance. The ghast and any ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.
Actions:
Bite. Attacco con arma da mischia: +3 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, one creature. Colpito: 12 (2d8 + 3) danni perforanti.

Claws. Attacco con arma da mischia: +5 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 10 (2d6 + 3) danni taglienti. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it deve superare un TS Costituzione CD 10 or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the tiro salvezza at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

name: Ghost
Damage Resistances: Acid, Fire, Lightning, Thunder; Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
Condition Immunities: Charmed, Exhaustion, Frightened, Grappled, Paralyzed, Petrified, Poisoned, Prone, Restrained
Languages: Any languages it knew in life
Traits:
Ethereal Sight. The ghost can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

Incorporeal Movement. The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It subisce 5 (1d10)force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.
Actions:
Withering Touch. Attacco con arma da mischia: +5 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 17 (4d6 + 3) necrotic damage.

Etherealness. The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

Horrifying Visage. Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the ghost that can see it deve superare un TS Saggezza CD 13 or be frightened for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target also ages 1d4 × 10 years. A frightened target can repeat the tiro salvezza at the end of each of its turns, ending the frightened condition on itself on a success. If a target's tiro salvezza is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this ghost's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a greater restoration spell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.

Possession (Ricarica 6). One humanoid that the ghost can see within 5 feet of it deve superare un TS Carisma CD 13 or be possessed by the ghost; the ghost then disappears, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The ghost now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being charmed and frightened. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the tiro salvezza or after the possession ends.

name: Ghoul

Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 20 Intelligence (Indagine) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

Invisible Passage. The hag magically turns invisible until she attacks or casts a spell, or until her concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While invisible, she leaves no physical evidence of her passage, so she can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment she wears or carries is invisible with her.

Luring Song. The harpy sings a magical melody. Every humanoid and giant within 300 feet of the harpy that can hear the song deve superare un TS Saggezza CD 11 or be charmed until the song ends. The harpy must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the harpy is incapacitated.

While charmed by the harpy, a target is incapacitated and ignores the songs of other harpies. If the charmed target is more than 5 feet away from the harpy, the target must move on its turn toward the harpy by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the harpy, the target can repeat the tiro salvezza. A charmed target can also repeat the tiro salvezza at the end of each of its turns. Se il tiro salvezza ha successo, the effect ends on it.

A target that successfully saves is immune to this harpy's song for the next 24 hours.

Wall of Ice (Ricarica 6). The devil magically forms an opaque wall of ice on a solid surface it can see within 60 feet of it. The wall is 1 foot thick and up to 30 feet long and 10 feet high, or it's a hemispherical dome up to 20 feet in diameter.

When the wall appears, each creature in its space is pushed out of it by the shortest route. The creature chooses which side of the wall to end up on, unless the creature is incapacitated. The creature then makes a TS Destrezza CD 17, taking 35 (10d6) danni da freddo on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The wall lasts for 1 minute or until the devil is incapacitated or dies. The wall can be damaged and breached; each 10-­foot section has AC 5, 30 hit points, vulnerability to danni da fuoco, and immunity to acid, cold, necrotic, poison, and danni psichici. If a section is destroyed, it leaves behind a sheet of frigid air in the space the wall occupied. Whenever a creature finishes moving through the frigid air on a turn, willingly or otherwise, the creature must make a TS Costituzione CD 17, taking 17 (5d6) danni da freddo on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The frigid air dissipates when the rest of the wall vanishes.

Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest). For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a tiro salvezza. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is incapacitated.
Reactions: Parry. The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

Pack Tactics. The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

name: Kraken
Damage Immunities: Lightning; Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
Languages: Abissale, Celestiale, Infernale, Primordial, Telepatia 36.6 m but can't speak
Traits:
Anfibio. The kraken può respirare aria e acqua.

Freedom of Movement. The kraken ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be restrained. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being grappled.

Siege Monster. The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.
Actions:
Multicolpo. The kraken makes three tentacle attacks, each of which it can replace with one use of Fling.

Bite. Attacco con arma da mischia: +17 a colpire, portata 1.5 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 23 (3d8 + 10) danni perforanti. If the target is a Large or smaller creature grappled by the kraken, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the kraken, and it subisce 42 (12d6)acido at the start of each of the kraken's turns.

If the kraken subisce 50damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken deve superare un TS Costituzione CD 25 at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the kraken. If the kraken dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

Tentacle. Attacco con arma da mischia: +17 a colpire, portata 9.1 m, un bersaglio. Colpito: 20 (3d6 + 10) danni contundenti, and the target is grappled (escape DC 18). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple un bersaglio.

Fling. One Large or smaller object held or creature grappled by the kraken is thrown up to 60 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target subisce 3 (1d6)danni contundenti for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature deve superare un TS Destrezza CD 18 or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

Lightning Storm. The kraken magically creates three bolts of lightning, each of which can strike a target the kraken can see within 120 feet of it. A target must make a TS Destrezza CD 23, taking 22 (4d10) danni da fulmine on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Legendary Actions:
The kraken can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The kraken regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Tentacle Attack or Fling. The kraken makes one tentacle attack or uses its Fling.

Lightning Storm (Costs 2 Azioni). The kraken uses Lightning Storm.

Ink Cloud (Costs 3 Azioni). While underwater, the kraken expels an ink cloud in a 60-foot radius. The cloud spreads around corners, and that area is heavily obscured to creatures other than the kraken. Ogni creatura other than the kraken that ends its turn there deve superare un TS Costituzione CD 23, taking 16 (3d10) danni da veleno on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A strong current disperses the cloud, which otherwise disappears at the end of the kraken's next turn.

At will: disguise self (any humanoid form), major image

3/day each: charm person, mirror image, scrying, suggestion

1/day: geas
